intro: Globulea × affinis, commonly known as the hybrid globulea, is a flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is a naturally occurring hybrid between Globulea lutea and Globulea paniculata, characterized by its dense, spherical clusters of small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and elliptical, glossy leaves. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in humid, well-drained soils. Its compact growth habit and showy inflorescences make it a popular ornamental plant in horticulture.
